description.narrative: Outcome 1: LGBTI people are empowered to claim their human rights. Outcome 2: The State and its administration units improve legal, policy and institutional framework for the protection of human rights of LGBTI people. Outcome 3: Advancing organizational ability to influence and interact with relevant stakeholders for achieving strategic objectives. Outcome 4: The state and its administrative units improve legal, policy and institutional framework for the gender equality and human rights of women, Outcome 5: Feminism and gender equality mainstreamed into public and political discourse and debate.

Insatsen utgör ett fortsatt budgetstöd till Sarajevo Open Centres och till dess Strategiska plan för perioden 2018-2020. SOC har under de senaste tre åren 2014-2017 lagt en än starkare grund för sitt arbete och en ledande roll i kampen för mänskliga rättigheter i Bosnien-Hercegovina, med särskild inriktning på LGBTI gruppens rättigheter men även på kvinnors mänskliga rättigheter i samhället. Organisationen arbetar brett med medvetandegörande insatser (advocacy) och lobby för att skapa och förändra lagstiftning och policies i en riktning som tillvaratar dessa gruppers rättigheter. Man arbetar aktivt med uppföljning och dokumentation av övergrepp, tar fram årsrapporter om kvinnor situation i landet. Man medverkar och samverkar på olika sätt med regeringen (government) och med institutioner i båda entiteterna och med partier och parliament för att påverka situation för LGBTI och kvinnors rättigheter i en positiv riktning. Man utbildar tjänstemän och i den medvetandegörande verksamheten finns stort fokus på juridsk rådgvning, social mobilisering av det civila samhället samt organisationsutveckling och nätverksbyggande.

The initiative represents a continued budgetary support (core support) for the Sarajevo Open Centers and its Strategic Plan for the period 2018-2020. In the last three years 2014-2017, SOC has laid an even stronger foundation for its work and its unique role as a leading organization in the fight for human rights in Bosnia and Herzegovina, with a particular focus on the rights of the LGBTI group, but also on women's human rights in society. The organization works widely with advocacy efforts and lobbying to create and change legislation and policies in a direction that safeguards the rights of these groups. One actively works with follow-up and documentation of abuse, presents annual reports on women's situation in the country. Participating and interacting in various ways with government authorities and with institutions in both entities, as well as with parties and parliament to influence the situation of LGBTI and women's rights in a positive direction. SOC is training staff and in the awareness-raising business, and where there is a great deal of focus on legal advice, social mobilization of civil society and organizational development and networking.

tag.narrative: 16.b - Promote and enforce non-discriminatory laws and policies for sustainable development.
16.b - Verka för och genomdriva icke-diskriminerande lagstiftning och politik för en hållbar utveckling.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Covid-19 has impacted SOC work to certain extents, when activities were cancelled or postponed and access to decision makers has decreased. Therefore, some of the results that were expected from the programme were not realised. For example, SOC makes the conclusion that covid-19 made LGBTI persons from the community not seeking support from SOC to the extent expected before corona, as they were forced to deal with other problems (employment, health). On an overall level, however, SOC has managed to achieve great results, not least since this has been the final year of implementation (apart from the 6 months extension in 2021). SOC has kept its strategic focus and managed to influence various actors to push for LGBTI-rights and strengthening the movement. SOC played a crucial role to strengthen the LGBTI community, through increased engagement among members of the LGBTI community, showcased by an increase in the number of initiatives from the community in terms of events, gatherings, exhibitions, etc. As such, SOC has contributed to strengthen and connect local groups, decentralize activism and make the voices of LGBTI persons coming from local communities heard giving them the space and means to express their needs. Although the pandemic implied that governmental and entity working groups have not been operating to the expected extent, and not focusing on the issues relevant to the LGBTI-community, SOC has maintained the contact through continued lobbying and advocacy. However, although SOC aimed at influencing political parties, none of the political parties have stepped out publicly in thier support to LGBTI people's human rights. SOC states that 2020 has been a year of political turmoil over the issues that occured due to the pandemic,and the response of the institutions to these circumstance, human rights were disregarded and rarely addressed, especially the human rights of the minorities. SOC's advocacy has also led to contrete progress, in terms of the intiated regular meetings of the interministerial work group tasked with analyzing and proposing provisions regarding same sex partnerships, which is one of two policy initiatives regarding human rights of LGBTI people that entered government procedures in 2020. SOC has also played a key role in the development and consolidation of the Action Plan for Improved Human Rights of LGBTI people in BiH 2021-2022. On the local level, it is an achievement that a previous participant of SOC activites has proposed the adoption of a conprehesive Cantonal Gender Action Plan that would also include LGBTI human rights. Further work has been carried out in regards to pushing for action at different levels in the public administration and among political levels. Internal capacity building and empowerment of the movement have also been provided by SOC, and awareness raising has taken place.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
